law.catch_line: Definitions Applicable To Secs. 180 A To 180 L1/2

text.section: a contract for the purchase or sale of a commodity for future delivery on, or subject to the rules of, a board of trade or contract market under the Commodity Exchange Act, 7 U.S.C. § 1, et seq. or a board of trade outside the United States;

an agreement that is subject to regulation under section 19 of the Commodity Exchange Act, 7 U.S.C. § 1, et seq. and that is commonly known to the commodities trade as a margin account, margin contract, leverage account or leverage contract;
an agreement or transaction that is subject to regulation under Section 4c(b) of the Commodity Exchange Act and that is commonly known to the commodities trade as a commodity option;
any combination of the agreements or transactions referred to in this paragraph; or
any option to enter into an agreement or transaction referred to in this paragraph.
“Forward contract”, “repurchase agreement”, “securities contract” and “swap agreement” shall have the meanings set forth in the Federal Deposit Insurance Act, 12 U.S.C. § 1821(e)(8)(D), as amended.
